column4: I was wondering... i've heard about all sorts of horror stories with ATI cards and linux... if they were my only two options, would you reccmoend upgrading to a ATI Radeon 9200 or staying with a Geforce 4 MX 440?
funny i have a geforce mx 440, i switched it with my radeon 9800 pro for linux lol
so you're saying it'd be better to keep the geforce?
well I only barrowd that card from a friend but no, i wouldnt spend money on it
what do you do in linux that needs such a good card?
and i'd be getting the card for free so... :|
well humm i donnu 9200 is outdated as well so
i was just wondering weather i should try switching out the geforce or not.
well shure if its free then go for it
it's not that outdated... not nearly as much as the geforce is. o.O;
Does anybody now how to launch CXoffice?
i was just wondering how horrible installing an ati card is, and what the problems are...
Well its not that hard lol.... but nvidia is way easier. There is a tutorial for Ati drivers on ubuntuforums.org
ah, well, i've heard stuff about drivers causing lockups the like.
however, considering the performance jump, i'm probably going to give it a shot.
not shure about that i didnt use it for long
